alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 3:40PM EDT until March 26 at 2:36AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek Above Findlay affecting Hancock County. For the Eagle Creek (Hancock)...including Findlay...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek Above Findlay. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Eagle Creek will overrun its banks and begin to inundate portions of Fremont and Graceland Avenue. Water will inundate a field near Rosemont Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 7.6 feet late tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 02/18/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM EDT.
